column1: DASH diet to lower high blood pressure
The DASH diet can help lower high blood pressure and cholesterol and other fats in your blood.
This diet is low in sodium (salt) and rich in nutrients.
Lowering sodium to 1,500 mg a day reduces blood pressure even more.

Your health care provider may suggest cutting back to 1,500 mg a day if you: - Already have high blood pressure - Have diabetes or chronic kidney disease - Are African American - Are age 51 or older If you take medicine to treat high blood pressure, do not stop taking your medicine while on the DASH diet.
